intro: Petraeovitex riedelii, commonly known as the rock vitex, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. Petraeovitex riedelii thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in forested or scrubland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
